column4: if you only need  to recompile a module and there is a source package in the repo for it .. .yes install the source package and use module-assistant to compile it (or fetch the source via modue-assistant)
i did not get the package from the repo's i got it from http://phep2.technion.ac.il/linmodems/packages/smartlink/ , should i use the repo package that the massistant wants to download?
wih debian kernels you should always use what the repo provides. debian as a highly customised/patched/hacked kernel and so are the source packages (to fit the kernel)

ok, thanks then, by the way i have another system , with a raid card, fasttrak tx2000, i had asked before on here for help and i was told to look for a driver which i found on the live cd, anyway that should mean that it should have worked but the drives (two of them) were detected seprtate, raid is supposed to be seen a uniform value of total drive space,is it different in ubuntu or was the raid card not detected?
